header.title:
Personal Values
Assessment
header.description: Discover your core personal values and learn how they shape your decisions, relationships, and overall well-being.
header.startMessage: Begin your journey of self-awareness — the assessment takes no more than 15 minutes.

privacy.note:
* Your personal data stays personal.
This application is designed in the way everything you enter, choose, or reflect on is stored locally in your browser — it never leaves your device, and no data is sent to any server.
You are in full control.
No tracking. No analytics. No hidden collection.
If you ever want to clear your answers, you can reset your session anytime.

results.title: Assessment Results
results.description: They reflect what truly matters to you — the principles that shape your choices, relationships, and direction in life. Keep them close; they're your compass.

topValues.title: Your Top 5 Values
topValues.description: These values represent the core principles that resonate with you the most. They are the guiding lights in your life, shaping your decisions and actions.

selection.title: Select Your Values
selection.description:
What matters to you, really? Pick the values that feel like "you."
Select at least {required} values that resonate with you.

faq.a: Personal core values are the beliefs and inner principles that guide your decisions, actions, and relationships. They shape how you lead, what you prioritize, and how you define success. These values aren't just abstract ideas — they're deeply felt drivers of behavior. When you're clear on them, you navigate life with more confidence and clarity. Values like curiosity, honesty, autonomy, or compassion reflect who you are at your core — not who others expect you to be.

faq.q: Why does knowing your values matter?
faq.a: When you know your core values, you make decisions with more ease and integrity. You feel more aligned in your work, relationships, and leadership. Your values help you define what "success" actually means to you — and they serve as a compass when things get unclear or challenging. Without clarity on your values, it's easy to feel pulled in too many directions or stuck in roles that no longer fit who you are.

faq.q: How does this values assessment work?
faq.a: This is a quick, reflective tool designed to help you identify your Top 5 personal values. You'll review a carefully curated list of values, choose the ones that resonate most, and then prioritize them. It only takes a few minutes — but the insight you gain can be long-lasting. The goal isn't perfection — it's self-awareness. Once you know your values, you can start making decisions and setting goals that truly align.

This assessment is for leaders, professionals, and anyone who wants to live and lead more intentionally. Whether you're navigating change, working with a coach, or simply curious about what drives you, this tool helps you connect with what matters most. It's especially useful during career transitions, leadership development, or moments when you're feeling stuck or out of sync. Clarity on your values leads to clarity in your actions.

Yes — and that's a sign of growth. As you evolve, face new challenges, or experience meaningful shifts in life, some values may rise in importance while others fade. Checking in with your values helps you stay aligned with who you are becoming, not just who you've been. This assessment isn't about locking yourself into fixed ideas — it's about staying grounded and intentional in how you lead and live.

faq.q: What will I get at the end?
faq.a: You'll receive a clear, prioritized list of your Top 5 personal values, each with a short reflection to help you explore how it shows up in your life and leadership. You'll also see how your values are balanced across four key motivation groups — offering insight into what drives you, where tensions may exist, and how to stay aligned with what matters most. It's a simple, personal snapshot of your inner compass — one you can return to whenever you need clarity, direction, or a moment of reflection.

tensions.balanced: You show a relatively balanced emphasis between {groupA} and {groupB}, suggesting flexibility in navigating these areas.
tensions.mildContrast: You appear to lean toward {dominant}, but still show awareness of the values associated with {lesser}.
tensions.clearPreference: You show a clear preference for {dominant}, while placing less importance on {lesser}. This may reflect a prioritization of one approach over the other.
tensions.strongContrast: There is a strong contrast between your preference for {dominant} and your lower emphasis on {lesser}. This tension might shape important decisions or challenges.

groupAnalysis.summary: Your values are centered around {topSummary}. You prioritize this over {bottomSummary}.
groupAnalysis.polarizationMessage: There's a significant gap ({gap} points) between your focus on {topLabel} and your lesser emphasis on {bottomLabel}. This may lead to inner tension between your aspirations and your need for stability or balance.

SelfTranscendence.high: How do you care for yourself while caring for others?
SelfTranscendence.low: Where might more compassion or shared purpose energize your direction?

SelfEnhancement.high: How does your drive for achievement support — or compete with — your relationships?
SelfEnhancement.low: What would you pursue more boldly if recognition didn't matter?

OpennessToChange.high: Where are you being called to explore something new right now?
OpennessToChange.low: What new experiences might stretch your perspective?

Conservation.high: Where does structure or routine help you feel safe right now?
Conservation.low: What small rituals might create more stability in your life?

selfDirection.label: Self-Direction
selfDirection.description: Independent thought and action; choosing, creating, exploring.

universalism.label: Universalism
universalism.description: Understanding, appreciation, tolerance, and protection for the welfare of all people and for nature.

stimulation.label: Stimulation
stimulation.description: Excitement, novelty, and challenge in life.

hedonism.label: Hedonism
hedonism.description: Pleasure and sensuous gratification for oneself.

achievement.label: Achievement
achievement.description: Personal success through demonstrating competence according to social standards.

power.label: Power
power.description: Social status and prestige, control or dominance over people and resources.

security.label: Security
security.description: Safety, harmony, and stability of society, of relationships, and of self.

conformity.label: Conformity
conformity.description: Restraint of actions, inclinations, and impulses likely to upset or harm others and violate social expectations or norms.

tradition.label: Tradition
tradition.description: Respect, commitment, and acceptance of the customs and ideas that traditional culture or religion provide.

benevolence.label: Benevolence
benevolence.description: Preserving and enhancing the welfare of those with whom one is in frequent personal contact.

comparison.title: What Guides You Most?
comparison.description: You've selected values that resonate with you — great start. In this step, we'll help you clarify what matters most by comparing them directly. Just choose the one that feels more important in each pair.
comparison.finishComparisonFirst: You need to finish comparison to see results
